content.subtitle: Object.prototype and Object.constructor

paragraph.info: Protototype is not the same as __proto__ proterty. Only Native Object have prototype Object.protototype, Array.protototype. Also the Instance of Furnction has prototype therefore they could be chain to other object Prototype in javascript inheritance (delegation).

content.subtitle: JavaScript classes are functions as constructors

paragraph.info: When U ceate a class in jabascript you simply create a new Function. Since every instance of function in javascript has protototype and protototype.constructor (aiming to the same function) you can chain them to other object passing prototype values.

content.subtitle: functions and function constructors

paragraph.info: functions and function constructors. Every funciton can be constructor. To make function a constructor you need to call it with a new Keyword. Next section explain what that does in details.

content.subtitle: what that keyword 'new' does ?

paragraph.info:
new keyword does few things: 1. bind Obj.getPrototype(functionInstance) = functionInstance.prototype //wasnt the case above 2. binds functionInstance.constructor === functionInstance.prototype.constructor; //wasnt the case before
so the class intance has the same prototype as Class itslelf we deal with the same object. Classes are function in javascript that have constructors that craated this function and prototype set to this function as well.

inheritance between classes:
so prototype of one class become prototype of another class by:
Object.setPrototypeOf(classInstance1,Class.prototype);
in the way those match:
Object.getPrototypeOf(classInstance) === Object.getPrototypeOf(classInstance1) //true classInstance.constructor === classInstance1.constructor //true

inheritance between classes:
so prototype of one class become prototype of another class by:
classInstance1 = Object.create(Class.prototype);
in the way those match:
Object.getPrototypeOf(classInstance) === Object.getPrototypeOf(classInstance1) //true classInstance.constructor === classInstance1.constructor //true

content.subtitle: extends and super();
ES7 class Syntax

paragraph.info:
The class property syntax is a Stage 3 proposal so it’s not part of the official JS spec yet. Thefore You need an additional configuration to make it work, as expalained before. First you need to start with npm install:
npm install --save-exac @babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties

content.subtitle: Class static method()
Class get value() and set value() methods

paragraph.info: Class get value() and set value() methods: just like in any object you can use functionality or get value() and set value() methods on Class instance.
